meanings.definition: The quality of having a direction or orientation.
meanings.sent1: The map showed the directionality of the roads in the city.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle always points north, demonstrating directionality.
meanings.sent3: The confused squirrel's directionality led it in circles around the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her strong sense of directionality guided her through the maze of city streets.
meanings.sent5: The arrow's directionality was clear as it pointed towards the target.

meanings.definition: The property of being unidirectional or bidirectional.
meanings.sent1: The new microphone had excellent directionality, capturing sound from one direction only.
meanings.sent2: The antenna's directionality allowed it to receive signals from multiple sources.
meanings.sent3: The robot's faulty directionality caused it to spin in circles instead of moving forward.
meanings.sent4: The flashlight's strong directionality illuminated the path ahead clearly.
meanings.sent5: The traffic sign's directionality indicated which way to turn at the intersection.

meanings.definition: The tendency to move or progress in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The river's directionality carried the leaves downstream.
meanings.sent2: The wind's directionality determined the path of the kite in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful directionality led it straight to the ball every time.
meanings.sent4: The team's directionality towards the goal ensured their success in the match.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower's directionality as it turned towards the sun was a beautiful sight.
